author: cuckconundrum
text:
That's a very eurocentric opinion. Yes yes, we all know European countries and Brazil + Argentina do have established football culture and infrastructure, which also lead to very high quality for their national teams.

But tournament-wise, the World Cup is literally the pinnacle of football competition. Who knows, we might have a surprise country in the final next year? Morocco almost did it.

author: Zanahoria132
text:
World cup is simply better because it's top European teams + top south Americans (Brasil, Argentina, Uruguay + Colombia and Ecuador in really good form right now) + Countries from other regions that would be rough against most european teams (Japan, Morocco, teams like South Korea, Ghana or Cameroon in previous WC, even the US and Mexico are rough etc.)

Every top club in Europe has lots of talent from other continents.

Sure you might get some boring dead matches in the WC here and there, but you can't say Euros is a better tournament when like 50% of top talent doesn't participate.

author: [deleted]
text: [deleted]

author: Zanahoria132
text:
I mean sure, but "good" teams like Netherlands, Portugal, Belgium have never won it. In the Euros you have teams like Georgia, Albania, Romania, Scotland which wouldn't compete against Japan, Ecuador or Morocco. Even Costa Rica or the US have left european teams out of group stages! Imagine the "best" tournament not having Salah, Hakimi, Son or the likes of Eto'o, Suarez, Mane, Drogba, Park, Alexis Sanchez...

There's no concentration of football talent at national level like in the world cup. That's just a fact.
